name: Optics & Optical Systems
description: Sector template for optical system patents including lenses, waveguides, optical fibers, and light manipulation technologies.
contextDescription: Optics patents cover optical components and systems used in cameras, displays, fiber communications, and sensing. Key areas include lens design, waveguide technology, optical coatings, light modulation, and photonic devices. High-value patents often relate to miniaturization for mobile devices, AR/VR applications, or high-performance imaging.
scoringGuidance: Patents enabling smartphone camera miniaturization have high market relevance.
Waveguide patents for AR/VR headsets are high-value emerging targets.
Fiber optic innovations apply to both telecom and data center markets.
Consider both consumer electronics and industrial/medical imaging applications.
Look for patents bridging traditional optics with computational photography.

questions.question: What type of optical component does this patent address? Score based on market impact: 1-3 for specialized/niche components, 4-6 for common components (lenses, filters), 7-10 for fundamental components in high-volume applications.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the optical component type and its applications. Consider market size and growth potential.

questions.question: Does this patent enable optical miniaturization for mobile devices, wearables, or compact systems? Score 1-3 for bulk optics only, 4-6 for moderate miniaturization, 7-10 for significant mobile/wearable applicability.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess miniaturization benefits for smartphones, AR/VR, wearables, and IoT devices.

questions.question: How applicable is this patent to augmented reality or virtual reality systems? Consider waveguides, display optics, eye tracking, and optical combiners.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify AR/VR applications. This is a fast-growing market with limited competition in optical IP.

questions.question: How manufacturable is the optical technology described? Score 1-3 for complex/expensive processes, 4-6 for standard manufacturing, 7-10 for mass-production compatible designs.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess manufacturing complexity and scalability. High-volume feasibility increases patent value.
